entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 10 at 2:22PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Significant Snow Southeast of Delta Junction Starting Tonight... Significant snow will develop southeast of Delta Junction tonight and continue through tomorrow morning. Between 1 and 4 inches of snow are possible southeast of Delta Junction, with the heaviest snow from Dry Creek to Tok and south of Donnelly Dome. South of Trims DOT Camp, north winds gusting to 30 mph will cause areas of
entry.cap:areaDesc: Deltana and Tanana Flats; Eastern Alaska Range; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 10 at 2:07PM AKDT until October 12 at 4:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TUESDAY TO 4 PM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 8 inches. Wind gusts up to 50 mph causing blowing snow will reduce visibility to one half mile or less at times. * WHERE...Western Arctic Coast.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 10 at 2:07PM AKDT until October 12 at 10:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TUESDAY TO 10 PM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 3 inches. entry.title: Flood Watch issued October 10 at 1:17PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon through late Friday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, other low-lying areas and flood-prone locations. Isolated landslides are possible in areas of steep terrain.

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued October 10 at 6:22PM MST until October 10 at 7:30PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR NORTHWESTERN MOHAVE COUNTY... At 622 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain has decreased across the warned area. However, runoff from earlier storms continues and flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 10 at 9:14PM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Cocoa 9w affecting Brevard County. .Lingering higher water from Hurricane Ian in late September will keep the Saint Johns River near Cocoa in Moderate Flood stage through at least mid week before starting a slow, steady decline by this weekend.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 10 at 9:13PM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Above Lake Harney affecting Seminole County. .Historic rainfall from Hurricane Ian will cause levels along the Saint Johns river to remain high as water moves downstream through the basin. The forecast point above Lake Harney at Geneva is experiencing record flooding. Despite a slow decline, the river

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 10 at 9:11PM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Sanford affecting Seminole County. .Historic rainfall from Hurricane Ian will cause levels along the Saint Johns river to remain high as water moves downstream through the basin. The forecast point at Sanford is forecast to remain near the record crest of 8.9 feet today before beginning a slow decline.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 10 at 9:09PM EDT until further notice by NWS

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 10 at 8:58PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Locally Dense Fog... Patchy fog has developed across portions of the Upper Hudson Valley into southern Vermont this evening. There is locally dense fog with visibilities of a half mile or less especially in areas that received rain today. Motorists are advised to be prepared for rapid changes in visibility.

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued October 10 at 3:53PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: An Air Quality Alert by the Washington Department of Ecology in Yakima for Chelan and Douglas counties continues until further notice. The Washington Department of Ecology has announced an Air Quality Alert for Chelan and Douglas counties, due to risk of wildfire smoke. This Air Quality alert is in effect until further notice.
